alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 3:14AM EST until March 04 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level is expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Tidal areas in New Castle County, Delaware and in Salem County, New Jersey. * WHEN...From 7:00 AM until 11:00 AM this morning. * IMPACTS...At this level, flooding begins on the most vulnerable roads along tidal waterways. Some partial or full road closures are possible. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Delaware River at Reedy Point MLLW Categories - Minor 7.2 ft, Moderate 8.2 ft, Major 9.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 2.4 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 04/09 AM 7.5 1.7 2.0 Minor 04/10 PM 5.6 -0.2 0.5 None 05/10 AM 6.1 0.3 0.6 None 05/10 PM 5.6 -0.2 0.4 None 06/11 AM 5.8 -0.0 0.2 None 06/11 PM 5.6 -0.2 0.4 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
